newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-AWB puts 96/97 Australian wheat crop at 19 MT.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-AWB puts 96/97 Australian wheat crop at 19 MT.

text.p: The Australian Wheat Board (AWB) said it raised its forecast of the 1996/97 Australian wheat crop to 19.0 million tonnes from its previous forecast of 17.6 million tonnes.
The crop revision brings the AWB more into line with other official, private and trade forecasters.
The highest on-the-record forecast is 19.8 million tonnes, issued by private forecaster Australian Wheat Forecasters Pty Ltd last week.
Earlier last week, the government's commodities forecaster, the Australian Bureau of Agricultural and Resource Economics (ABARE), put the crop at 18.8 million tonnes.
While the AWB had kept its official forecast at much lower levels, the trade has been privately estimating the Australian crop at 20 million tonnes or more for more than a month.
The AWB forecast strengthens the view that Australia is headed for its second highest wheat crop on record, after the 22 million tonnes of 1983/84.
The 1996/97 wheat crop will form most of a 28.7 million tonne total winter crop forecast last week by ABARE, near the 1983/84 record 29.96 million tonnes.
The grain trade has for some time been saying the AWB has been overly conservative in its crop estimate.
The board has said frost in Queensland and areas in wheat cultivation for the first time created special problems.
